title: allopathic medicine - Wiktionary, the free dictionary
cleaned_text: system of [alternative medicine](/wiki/alternative_medicine)that treats symptoms with substances that produce opposite symptoms; opposite of [homeopathy](/wiki/homeopathy). [Modern](/wiki/modern) [Western](/wiki/Western) [medicine](/wiki/medicine). Usage notes[ [edit](/w/index.php?title=allopathic_medicine&action=edit§ion=3)] When used to refer to conventional medicine, this word is increasingly considered derogatory by its practitioners. This second meaning is primarily used by [homeopaths](/wiki/homeopath) and some American [osteopaths](/wiki/osteopath) to differentiate their medical practices from conventional medical practices.
